meanings.sent1: The flowers in the garden burgeon with each passing day.
meanings.sent2: Her business started to burgeon after she implemented new marketing strategies.
meanings.sent3: The idea to start a lemonade stand burgeoned into a plan to open a juice bar.
meanings.sent4: Hope began to burgeon in their hearts as they saw the first signs of spring.
meanings.sent5: The excitement in the room burgeoned as the announcement of the winner drew near.

meanings.sent1: The small business began to burgeon into a successful company.
meanings.sent2: With proper care, the plant will burgeon and fill the entire pot.
meanings.sent3: The town's population started to burgeon after the opening of a new factory.
meanings.sent4: Her talent for painting began to burgeon, attracting the attention of art collectors.
meanings.sent5: The music festival is expected to burgeon in attendance this year.

meanings.definition: To begin to grow or blossom
meanings.sent1: The seeds planted in the soil will soon burgeon into beautiful flowers.
meanings.sent2: As spring arrives, the trees in the park will burgeon with fresh green leaves.
meanings.sent3: The friendship between the two children started to burgeon after they shared their toys.
meanings.sent4: Her interest in photography began to burgeon when she received a camera as a gift.
meanings.sent5: The love between the couple continued to burgeon with each passing year.
